sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt): Obtain from chemical supply companies or metal suppliers. P (Phosphorus): Purchase from chemical suppliers or specialized online retailers. Tb (Terbium): Source from rare earth metal suppliers. Tc (Technetium): Acquire from licensed nuclear material suppliers or specialized chemistry suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt): Obtain from chemical supply companies or metal suppliers. P (Phosphorus): Purchase from chemical suppliers or specialized online retailers. Tb (Terbium): Source from rare earth metal suppliers. Tc (Technetium): Acquire from licensed nuclear material suppliers or specialized chemistry suppliers.

1. Measure out 170 g of cobalt powder, 120 g of phosphorus powder, 40 g of terbium powder, and 30 g of technetium powder using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing bowl, combine the cobalt, phosphorus, terbium, and technetium powders. 3. Use a spatula or a mechanical mixer to thoroughly blend the powders for at least 10 minutes, ensuring uniform distribution of each element.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 170 g of cobalt powder, 120 g of phosphorus powder, 40 g of terbium powder, and 30 g of technetium powder using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing bowl, combine the cobalt, phosphorus, terbium, and technetium powders. 3. Use a spatula or a mechanical mixer to thoroughly blend the powders for at least 10 minutes, ensuring uniform distribution of each element.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature crucible suitable for metal processing. 2. Place the crucible in a muffle furnace and heat it to 1200 째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 3 hours to ensure complete reaction and homogeneity of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature crucible suitable for metal processing. 2. Place the crucible in a muffle furnace and heat it to 1200 째C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 3 hours to ensure complete reaction and homogeneity of the material.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25 째C). 2. Avoid opening the furnace during the cooling process to prevent contamination.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25 째C). 2. Avoid opening the furnace during the cooling process to prevent contamination.

steps: 1. Once cooled, retrieve the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinding tool to smooth the surface and edges of the sample, achieving desired dimensions. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the material from oxidation if it will be exposed to air. 4. Store the finished sample in a dry, inert atmosphere to preserve its properties.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, retrieve the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinding tool to smooth the surface and edges of the sample, achieving desired dimensions. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the material from oxidation if it will be exposed to air. 4. Store the finished sample in a dry, inert atmosphere to preserve its properties.
